text:
Sonia prepares to leave, urgency in her eyes.  
“Then I will tell Katerina Ivanovna you’re coming.”  

Raskolnikov interrupts, intent.  
“One minute, Sofya Semyonovna. We have no secrets.”  
“I need to talk to you about Porfiry Petrovitch.”  

---

Razumihin leans in, intrigued.  
“Isn’t he managing that murder case?”  
“Yes… why?”  

Sonia fidgets, anxious.  
“I have some pledges there—my father’s watch.”  
“I can’t lose it! What should I do?”  

---

Razumihin’s excitement bubbles over.  
“Certainly not the police! Go to Porfiry!”  
“Let’s go at once! We’ll find him!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sonia expresses concern about losing her father's watch and seeks advice on how to retrieve her pawned items without alarming her mother.
